text: <@U0UHG4VP1> what is your opinion about this copyright date? <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3863/> I would leave it to be 2016
<@U1AU8DRQR> I don't think there should be any dates in copyright headers at all
(I would also vote for removing such dates)
I am not a lawyer
yeah agreed
aren't you? :open_mouth:
but if the file was created in 2016 then it should be 2016 I guess - no matter it was moved or anything
am I right?
which file?
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3863/>  orderer/sbft_test.go
sorry I failed to paste the link last time
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3863/5/orderer/sbft/simplebft/simplebft_test.go> ?
yeah yeah that one
it looks like you updated it to me - personally, if it is edited, I would update the year. the issue is the copyright is IBM's to assign
let me say that in a different way: it's IBM's copyright, your edits may not be under that copyright. Am I correct in this theory?
wait not that file, I will paste a correct link
(that copyright is right, it was made by Simon as an IMBer)
this one: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3635/21/orderer/sbft_test.go>
ah this makes a lot more sense :slightly_smiling_face: I wouldn't update it as it is a copy, but again, IANAL
I would do the same as you. the file was created in 2016. it was moved. it is totally useless to update it in every year
btw it would be so cool to have months and days in those copyrights
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xs73-eVBu6I>
<@U0UHG4VP1>: I have created a job here for testing.. but this is an existing job which has maven code to publish log to nexus..  <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/sandbox/job/fabric-nexus-docker/>

<@U0UHG4VP1> - Power nodes are still not connecting to the Jenkins master. <@U11NUTP4L> updated libjffi.so on all nodes and rebooted them. That still didn't fix the issue. Could you please remove all Power nodes and add one back and see if the ssh-agent connects to the master ?
<@U0UHG4VP1> thanks - sorry, got distracted yesterday
I take it that the access is intended to be R/O except for you?
<@U0UHG4VP1> ok, I am a bit confused by the Nexus docs
is OSS version pegged at <http://v2.14.xxx|v2.14.xxx> ?
<@U11HH3P7Y> or <@U0UHG4VP1> why did CI run on this? <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4071/1>
it has [ci skip]
seems ci-skip plugin is broken so <@U0UHG4VP1> removed it from fabric wrappers.
ok, thanks
<@U0KM61BCP>: nexus is r/o except for Jenkins. I can create repos but publishing has to come from Jenkins
Also, as of last week the oss version was 2.14
do I need to make a formal ask to purchase the pro version?
<@U0UHG4VP1> <https://www.sonatype.com/download-oss-sonatype>
OSS version is 3 something
we have our releng meeting in an hour, could I ask then? I want to make sure I have the latest information
see the link
3.2 is latest OSS
now could be new since then
but we need docker and npm
and maven
I know we have a pro license but I'm not sure what version and what projects it covers
by we I mean LF not HYP
understood
so I will ask these questions in the release engineering meeting and I will let you know what options we have.
thanks
<@U0UHG4VP1> looks to me that if we want to upgrade, we may need to upgrade from 2.14.0 to 2.14.1 and then to whatever is the latest and THEN we can upgrade to 3.2
we may want to just burn down and start from scratch with 3.2
We would be the first project on 3.x. I'll ask how the SA team wants to handle it
<@U12V3D2P2> do you mean for me to remove power-1 as well as power-2...5?
<@U0UHG4VP1> yes all of them but as of now, power-2 to power-5 are down
So please remove all of them and add power-1 back
ok <@U12V3D2P2> power-1 was deleted and added, which job should I use to test it?
<@U12V3D2P2> let's watch this job: <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-cop-verify-ppc64le/30/console>
looks like it failed in the same way
Sure
Oh! 30 is the latest run?
yes, 30 and 31 are on power-1 and after delete/add cycle
Ok..still same problem then, could you please let me know the version of ssh-agent?
Is it upgraded recently?
I can't easily tell when it was upgraded, but not in the last few weeks at least
Ok

<@U12V3D2P2> I'm not sure if this is an issue or a result of the failures that are occurring:
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class jnr.enxio.channels.Native$SingletonHolder
Wonder if classpath needs to be updated?  Don't really know.
I see this before the above error: FATAL: Could not find a suitable ssh-agent provider
So could be Path issue..need to look into it some more
<https://github.com/jruby/jruby/issues/3660>

text: <@U0KM61BCP>: LF has one other project that is rolling out Nexus 3 over the next two weeks. After that is stood up, getting Nexus 3 will be easy for us.
<@U0UHG4VP1> is the backlog really that much? we really cannot wait another 2 weeks
I guess we could explore other alternatives
<@U0KM61BCP> I'll ask.
thanks
<@U0UHG4VP1> <@U11HH3P7Y> <@U12V3D2P2> <@U0YK3KKCY> , I was able to fix the ssh-agent issue on the Power servers. Currently the builds are getting started on hyp-power-[1,2,5]

however I see that hyp-power-3 and hyp-power-4 build nodes are appearing to be offline for some reason even though I am able to ssh to them. <@U0UHG4VP1> could you please remove these 2 nodes and add it back to see if that helps ? I have checked rebooting the slave nodes and that hasn't helped
